moves.1. c4:
My standard opening with white for the last 6 years. I like the
variations and transpositions that mean there is never a dull game
moves.1... e5 2. Nc3 Nf6 3. Nf3 Nc6 4. g3: The Bremen variation which is again my preferred line
moves.4... d5 5. cxd5:
Almost an automatic capture as the point of the english opening is to
allow black to build a centre then destroy it. d5 cxd5 accomplishes this in
one move. There are rare exceptions - see my game with hityerclock
moves.5... Nxd5 6. Bg2:
And a rule of mine - if you start a fianchetto then complete it as soon as
possible}
moves.6... Nb6 7. O-O Be7 8. a4 a5 9. e3 Bg4 1:
Because I dislike Qp games i usually try to avoid playing d4 for as long as possible to make
it harder for black to transpose into one of the Qp lines. However here i had
no sensible alternative
All standard moves to here but then black started to apply the pressure
building up a small but definite advantage
moves.15... Bc8 16. Be3 Nd5 17. Rc1: Much better was Re1 preparing to take control of the open file
moves.17... Nxe3 18. fxe3: splitting my pawns into 3 groups of 2 and opening up the K defenses
moves.18... Bd6 19. Rf3 Qe7 20. Qc2 Re8 21. e4:
Working on the
principle that if your K is exposed then exchange Qs as soon as possible
moves.23... Rxe4 24. Rd1 Re8 25. Rb3 h5 26. Kf: Already thinking about engineering a draw even though a pawn down
moves.28... Kg7 29. Ke2 Ra7 30. Ke3 Bf5 31. Rb:
And blacks last few moves, beginning with the pointless Ra7, have frittered away any advantage
and so we slide into a draw
